title: 108_hr3744
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. SALE OR EXCHANGE OF LAND, OZARK-ST. FRANCIS AND OUACHITA NATIONAL FORESTS." is a condensed summary of a section related to the sale or exchange of land within the Ozark-St. Francis and Ouachita National Forests. The Secretary of Agriculture may sell or exchange National Forest System land in the Ouachita National Forest, including tracts with a work center, residences, and improvements. The Secretary of Agriculture may sell or exchange National Forest System land in the Ouachita National Forest, including tracts with a work center, residences, office buildings, and other structures. The Secretary of Agriculture may sell or exchange National Forest System land in the Ouachita National Forest, including tracts with various structures such as work centers, residences, and office buildings. Tracts 7, 8, and 9 are identified as isolated forestland and three residences on specific maps dated July 26, 2000. Tracts 10, 11, 12, and 13 in the Ouachita National Forest include a work center, two residences, and additional forest land, as identified on specific maps dated July 26, 2000. Tracts 14, 15, and 16 in the Ouachita National Forest consist of a residence, a residence and work center, and isolated forestland, as identified on specific maps dated July 26, 2000. In the Ozark-St. Francis National Forest, there are three tracts of land identified as Tract 750 with two residences and an administrative office, Tract 2736 with a work center, and Tract 2686 with a house. These tracts are located in Mountain View, Mountainburg, and House districts respectively. Three tracts of land in the Ozark-St. Francis National Forest are identified as Tract 2686 with a house, Tract 2807 with a house, and Tract 2556 with a work center. The tracts range in size from 0.25 to 2.0 acres and are located in Districts 6 and 3. Three tracts of land in the Ozark-St. Francis National Forest, identified as Tract 2735, Tract 2574, and Tract 2686, ranging from 0.514 to 0.75 acres, are subject to laws governing land conveyance for National Forest System purposes. The Secretary may accept cash equalization payments exceeding 25 percent of the land value for National Forest System purposes. Offers for sale or exchange under this Act may be solicited, with the Secretary having the authority to reject inadequate or not in the public interest offers. The Secretary can accept cash equalization payments for National Forest System purposes. Funds received through sale or exchange will be deposited into a specific fund and used for administrative facilities, land, or interests in land for national forests in Arkansas and Oklahoma. Appropriations are authorized as needed to implement the Act.
